introPageInstructions:
In this activity, you'll be able to color and build your own story of Saints Benedict and Scholastica!

For each page of story, you'll color the image and select a caption from the captions provided.

You’ll see all your pictures with the captions you selected at the end.

You can save your story to your device to continue working later. You can also print your story when you get to the end.

Click the Next arrow to get started!

Note: If you'd like to complete a previously saved story, use the Import Saved Story below.

captionOptions.captionLabel: Saints Benedict and Scholastica, pray that we may have the wisdom to love, serve, and praise God in our words and deeds.
“Either speak of God or keep silence, for, what in this world is so worthy of speech?”—Saint Scholastica.
Benedict learned of sister Scholastica’s death by a divine sign: he saw his sister’s soul ascend into heaven in the form of a white dove.
Benedict and Scholastica founded communities of believers who lived together in lives of prayer and meaningful work.
The Rule of Saint Benedict told members of the community how to spend their day.
Pray and Work
“The brethren are also to obey one another, knowing that by this road of obedience they are going to God.” (Rule of Saint Benedict, c. 71)
“Whoever you are . . . fulfill with the help of Christ this minimum Rule which we have written for beginners.” (Rule of Saint Benedict, c. 73)
“When the Work of God is ended, let all go out in perfect silence.” (Rule of Saint Benedict, c. 52)
“She should show them all that is good and holy by her deeds even more than by her words.” (Rule of Saint Benedict, chapter 2.11)
“In community, however, let prayer be very short, and when the Superior gives the signal let all rise together.” (Rule or Saint Benedict, c. 20)
“Let them prefer nothing whatever to Christ. And may He bring us all together to everlasting life!” Rule of Benedict, ch. 72)
